        Returns:

      • getChild

        public Box getChild(long type)
        Description copied from interface: Box
        Returns the child box with the specified type. If this box has no child with the given type, null is returned. To check if there is such a child hasChild(type) can be used. If more than one child exists with the same type, the first one will always be returned. A list of all children with that type can be received via getChildren(type).
        Specified by:
        getChild in interface Box
        Parameters:
        type - the type of child box to look for
        Returns:
        the first child box with the given type, or null if none is found

      • getChildren

        public java.util.List<Box> getChildren()
        Description copied from interface: Box
        Returns an ordered and unmodifiable list of all direct children of this box. The list does not contain the children's children.
        Specified by:
        getChildren in interface Box
        Returns:
        this box's children

      • getChildren

        public java.util.List<Box> getChildren(long type)
        Description copied from interface: Box
        Returns an ordered and unmodifiable list of all direct children of this box with the specified type. The list does not contain the children's children. If there is no child with the given type, the list will be empty.
        Specified by:
        getChildren in interface Box
        Parameters:
        type - the type of child boxes to look for
        Returns:
        this box's children with the given type
